intro: Bacularia canina, commonly known as the dog's bane, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in riparian zones. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
